message_1: Assuming a Vigenere cipher with a keyword of "MATH", use cryptanalysis to decrypt the following ciphertext: "KTXTZVCGJZRA".
message_2:
To decrypt a Vigenere cipher with a keyword, we will use the Vigenere decryption formula: P = (C - K) mod 26, where P is the plaintext letter, C is the ciphertext letter, and K is the keyword letter. We will convert each letter to its corresponding numerical value (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25).

The keyword "MATH" has the numerical values: M=12, A=0, T=19, H=7.

The ciphertext is "KTXTZVCGJZRA". We will decrypt it using the keyword "MATH".

1. K(10) - M(12) = -2 mod 26 = 24 -> Y
2. T(19) - A(0) = 19 mod 26 = 19 -> T
3. X(23) - T(19) = 4 mod 26 = 4 -> E
4. T(19) - H(7) = 12 mod 26 = 12 -> M
5. Z(25) - M(12) = 13 mod 26 = 13 -> N
6. V(21) - A(0) = 21 mod 26 = 21 -> V
7. C(2) - T(19) = -17 mod 26 = 9 -> J
8. G(6) - H(7) = -1 mod 26 = 25 -> Z
9. J(9) - M(12) = -3 mod 26 = 23 -> X
10. Z(25) - A(0) = 25 mod 26 = 25 -> Z
11. R(17) - T(19) = -2 mod 26 = 24 -> Y
12. A(0) - H(7) = -7 mod 26 = 19 -> T

The decrypted plaintext is "YTEMNVJZXZYT".
